docs.title: AVerMedia Developer Hub
docs.text:
This is a prototype for the AVerMedia Developer Hub (tentative name), a site for developers to learn about AVerMedia products and technologies. This site is built with Material for MkDocs, a documentation tool based on MkDocs.

The main contents are in the Softwares section, where we demonstrate some of the features of this site and different ways to handle documentation of software products.

This is a random image from Lorem Picsum.

docs.title: Internal Documentation
docs.text:
This section is only for internal use. It is supposed to serve as the maintenance guide for this site.

  • Overview
  • Docs Writing Guide
  • Maintenance Guide

docs.title: Docs Writing Guide
docs.text:
This guide is intended for the developers who are writing the documentation for AVerAI. Here you can find:

  • The basic rules you should follow to include your documents in this site.
  • The style guide for the documentation.
  • The introduction to the markdown features (including the basic ones and the extensions) that mkdocs-material supports.

docs.title: Change the icons
docs.text: The current icons are downloaded from our official website. The favicon is stored as assets/images/favicon.png, and the logo is stored as assets/images/logo.png. One can either replace the existing files, or change the logo and favicon settings in the theme section of the mkdocs.yml file.

docs.title: Theme/Plugin Features
docs.text: Here lists some of the enabled features in this demo site. For the full list of features enabled, please take a look at the mkdocs.yml file.

docs.title: Navigation
docs.text:
• Instant loading: while navigating to an internal page, instead of reloading the whole page, only the content of the new page will be loaded. (The common elements like the header will stay the same, which makes the site look like a single-page application.)
  • Progress indicator: a progress indicator will be shown at the top of the page if the page hasn't finished loading after 400 ms.
  • Tabs: the top-level sections are rendered as tabs below the header. The left sidebar will only contain the sub-sections of the current tab.
  • Sticky tabs: the tabs will stick to the top of the page when scrolling down.
  • Navigation sections: the top-level sections are rendered as groups in the sidebar.
  • Back-to-top button: a back-to-top button will be shown at the top of the page if the page is scrolled down.

For more details, please refer to the Material for MkDocs documentation.

docs.title: Site Search
docs.text:
The built-in search plugin is enabled.

  • Search suggestions: when typing in the search box, the search plugin will show the most likely completion which can be accepted with → Right key.
  • Search highlight: the search results will be highlighted with the color of the theme.

docs.title: Material for MkDocs 簡易教學
docs.text:
Material for MkDocs 是一個基於 MkDocs 的文檔產生工具，提供豐富的功能、現代化的外觀、且易於使用，適合撰寫技術文件、API 文件、使用者手冊等。 開發者只需要撰寫 Markdown 文件，就可以輕鬆生成靜態網頁，既可以直接部署到伺服器上， 也可以作為離線文件使用（基本上使用任何現代瀏覽器都可以開啟）。

本教學將會包含以下幾個部分，希望可以幫助初學者快速上手：

Note

標題旁邊有 的，表示該部分尚未完成

docs.title: 快速開始
docs.text:
包含安裝方式以及基本概念

快速開始

docs.title: 如何撰寫 Markdown 文件
docs.text:
包含常見語法，以及 mkdocs-material 擴充的語法

如何撰寫 Markdown 文件

docs.title: 設定 MkDocs 專案
docs.text:
如何設定 mkdocs.yml

設定 MkDocs 專案

docs.title: 建立不同版本的文件
docs.text:
如何使用 mike 建立並發布不同版本的文件

建立不同版本的文件

docs.title: 設定 MkDocs 專案
docs.text: 那個醬汁，再給我一分鐘我一定能完成的。

docs.title: 安裝
docs.text:
Windows 使用者別怕

以下的終端機指令除了 macos/Linux shell 以外，在 Windows 的 PowerShell 中也可以正常運作。

若 pip 和 mkdocs 指令無法使用，請將 Python 安裝路徑中的 Scripts 目錄加入系統環境變數 Path 中。 例如若 Python 安裝在 C:\path\to\Python311，則需要將 C:\path\to\Python311\Scripts 加入 Path 中。

官方最推薦的安裝方式是使用 pip 安裝，以下會以此方式為主。關於其他安裝方式，請直接參考 官方文件。

pip install mkdocs-material

透過以上指令，pip 會幫我們把所有的相關套件 (如 mkdocs) 都安裝好，不需要擔心。安裝完成後，可以先建立一個基本的專案，並用 mkdocs serve 確認效果。

mkdocs new my-docs
cd my-docs
mkdocs serve

透過上述指令，mkdocs 會在 my-docs 目錄下建立一個基本的專案。

接著在專案目錄中，mkdocs serve 可以啟動一個測試用的伺服器， 預設會在 http://localhost:8000 開啟。我們對專案做的所有更動（包含 Markdown 文件和設定檔等）都會即時反映在該網址上， 並自動重新載入，方便我們即時查看效果。在終端機中，mkdocs 也會顯示目前的建置狀態（有時會花比較多時間），或是語法、設定錯誤等等。

docs.title: 目錄結構
docs.text:
一個簡易的 mkdocs 專案結構大致如下：

my-docs/
├── docs/
│   ├── assets/
│   │   └── images/
│   │       └── logo.png
│   ├── index.md
│   └── section_1/
│       ├── index.md
│       ├── page_1.md
│       └── page_2.md
│       └── ...
└── mkdocs.yml
  • mkdocs.yml: 是 mkdocs 的設定檔，包含要啟用哪些功能、外觀配色、導覽列等等。
  • docs/: 可以想像成 mkdocs 的原始碼目錄，所有要出現在網頁中的文件、圖片、CSS 等，都要放在這個目錄下。 mkdocs 會自動將 docs 目錄下的所有 Markdown 文件編譯成靜態網頁。
  • docs/section_1/: 放在 docs 的子目錄中的 Markdown 文件，在網站上也會被放在子目錄中。
  • docs/assets/: 其實並沒有硬性規定要建立這個目錄，但把靜態資源（如圖片、CSS 等）放在這個目錄下是常見的作法， 這樣專案目錄會比較乾淨。

這個專案渲染出來的網頁，和 Markdown 文件的對應關係大致如下（假設網頁被放到 https://www.example.com/ ）：

網址 對應的 Markdown 文件 https://www.example.com/ docs/index.md https://www.example.com/section_1/ docs/section_1/index.md https://www.example.com/section_1/page_1/ docs/section_1/page_1.md https://www.example.com/section_1/page_2/ docs/section_1/page_2.md

docs.title: 設定檔
docs.text:
如上所述 mkdocs.yml 是 mkdocs 的設定檔，建議初學者可以先直接複製既有專案的設定檔 （如這個範例），只修改以下幾個部分：

  • site_name: 網站名稱
  • site_url: 網站 URL（需要先確認這份文件未來打算放在哪個位置，如果沒設定好的話，有些連結會無法正確運作）
  • nav: 用來定義網站的「導覽列」（navigation），導覽列視設定而定，可能會出現在網頁的左側或上側。

以 目錄結構 中的專案為例，nav 的設定方式大致如下：

nav:
  - Home: index.md
  - My Section 1:
    - section_1/index.md
    - My Page 1: section_1/page_1.md
    - My Page 2: section_1/page_2.md

如此你就會看到導覽列中有兩個 top-level 的連結，分別是 Home 和 My Section 1， My Section 1 底下會有兩個子連結 My Page 1 和 My Page 2，而 My Section 1 本身 也會連結到 section_1/index.md。

docs.title: 撰寫 Markdown 文件
docs.text:
這邊僅提供一個簡單的 Markdown 文件範例：

# Your title

Some text at the beginning of the document.

## Chapter 1

Some text at the beginning of Chapter 1.

### Section 1.1

Some text at the beginning of Section 1.1.

- Item 1
- Item 2
- Item 3

Tips

雖然還有比 h3 (###) 層級更低的標題（如 ####），但一般來說前三層的效果會是最明顯的。

關於 Markdown 語法，這邊不多贅述，請直接參考 如何撰寫 Markdown 文件。

docs.title: 發布
docs.text: 關於發布，由於我們希望文件都能包含版本資訊，因此請直接參考 建立不同版本的文件。

docs.title: 其他注意事項
docs.text:
• 如果需要產生離線文件（不是放在線上），請務必參考 設定 MkDocs 專案 中有關離線文件的說明，否則網頁間的連結會無法正常運作。
  • 熟悉 Markdown 語法的各位請特別注意，在 mkdocs-material 的語法中，所有巢狀列表使用的縮排都是 4 個空白，而不是常見的 2/3 個。

docs.title: 如何撰寫 Markdown 文件
docs.text: 那個醬汁，再給我一分鐘我一定能完成的。

docs.title: 建立不同版本的文件
docs.text: 那個醬汁，再給我一分鐘我一定能完成的。

docs.title: Softwares
docs.text:
As the home page of the software tab, our software products may be showcased here.

But this is just a prototype, so we are going to demonstrate different ways to handle software documentation, with a bunch of dummy software projects.

Here is a brief summary table of the dummy software projects in the demo:

Language Dummy Project Name Brief Description C++ Some Streaming SDK
  • Main docs handled by this mkdocs project (this site)
  • API reference generated by Doxygen
C++ Some Audio SDK
  • Almost all the docs generated by Doxygen
  • Only entry page handled by this mkdocs project (this site)
C++ Some Video SDK
  • Main docs handled by another mkdocs project
  • API reference generated by Doxygen
Python Some AI SDK Work in progress

Each method has its own pros and cons. It is recommended to take a look at these dummy projects to check the user experience. The pros and cons are listed in the main page of each project. Some of the features of the documentation tools (mkdocs-material and Doxygen) are also demonstrated in pages like "Getting Started".

  • Some Streaming SDK

    • mkdocs docs by main project
    • API reference by Doxygen

    Explore the SDK

  • Some Audio SDK

    • Almost all docs by Doxygen
    • mkdocs entry page to different versions

    Explore the SDK

  • Some Video SDK

    • mkdocs docs by sub-project
    • API reference by Doxygen

    Explore the SDK

  • Some AI SDK

    Pure Python project, work in progress

    Explore the SDK

docs.title: Some AI SDK
docs.text:
Some AI SDK helps you build an AI inference pipeline for your AI application. The only thing we want to demonstrate here is the API reference generated by MkDocs.

  • Getting Started

    Nothing to demonstrate here. See the Getting Started of the streaming SDK.

    Getting Started

  • Examples

    Nothing to demonstrate here. See the Examples of the streaming SDK.

    Examples

  • API Reference

    Different versions of the API reference (generated by MkDocs) are available for this SDK.

    API Reference

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text: Nothing to demonstrate here. See the Getting Started of the streaming SDK.

docs.title: Examples
docs.text: Nothing to demonstrate here. See the Examples of the streaming SDK.

docs.title: Some Audio SDK
docs.text: All the documentation for this SDK, except for this entry page, is generated by Doxygen.

docs.title: Pros
docs.text: • All the pages are properly versioned by the configuration in Doxyfile.

docs.title: Cons
docs.text:
• The look and feel is too outdated for the tutorial- and guide-style documentation, which makes it look less professional.
  • Only the entry page, not the sub-sections like "Getting Started", can be properly integrated into the sidebar of the site1.
  • The markdown features supported by Doxygen are limited compared to mkdocs-material.

Note

A footnote with a tooltip (hover text) is used here. In the Markdown source code, the text contents are duplicated for the footnote and the tooltip, which is not a good practice. However, the footnote-with-tooltip feature is not included in the community version of mkdocs-material (sponsors only).

docs.title: Versions
docs.text:
The following versions of the documentation are available:

  • Some Audio SDK 0.7
  • Some Audio SDK 0.6

  1. It is actually possible to put the links of sub-sections in the sidebar of the main site, but users will feel like they just jump to another site after clicking these links. Therefore, I personally prefer to just put the entry page in the sidebar, as an entry point to the Doxygen documentation. ↩

docs.title: Some Streaming SDK
docs.text:
The main documentation, including the guides, examples, and tutorials, is handled by the main mkdocs project, and the API references for different versions are generated by Doxygen.

The pros and cons of this approach are listed below.

docs.title: Pros
docs.text:
• The sections will have the same look and feel as the site.
  • The sections can be nicely integrated to the left navigation sidebar.

docs.title: Cons
docs.text: • All the sections except the API reference contents are NOT versioned .

docs.title: Sections
docs.text:
• Getting Started

    Almost all the software projects provide a getting started guide, so we have one too. mkdocs-material features like tabs and note/tips boxes are demonstrated here.

    Getting Started

  • Examples

    The two use cases in the example section show how the code blocks look in mkdocs-material. Features like line numbers and copy button are enabled.

    Examples

  • API Reference

    Several versions of the API reference (generated by Doxygen) are available for this SDK.

    API Reference

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text: In this section, you can see a collapsible note box, the code blocks in tabs, and a tip box.

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
The SDK can be easily installed with the following command.

For Ubuntu 22.04 users

For Ubuntu 22.04, some pre-requisites have to be installed first.

echo "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit."
LinuxWindows 
echo "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit."
echo "Sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua."

Write-Output "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit."
Write-Output "Sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua."

docs.title: Build the pipeline
docs.text:
test.py
print('Create a pipeline')
print('Add the source')
print('Add the processor')
print('Add the sink')
print('Link all the components together')

Tip

You can replace the useless prints with actual code.

docs.title: API Reference
docs.text:
Here we show how to integrate different versions of the API reference generated by Doxygen.

The API references are available for the following versions:

  • 1.3 (online | offline)
  • 1.2 (online | offline)

Warning

The version control for this SDK is actually problematic, because the getting started page and the examples are not versioned.

Versioning of the API reference

The patch version number and the smaller version numbers should not be included in the API reference, because a patch should not change the API. For example, the API of version 1.3.1 should be the same as the API of version 1.3.0.

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
You can see how are the appearance of the code blocks in the following use cases.

Here some common use cases of the SDK are demonstrated.

  • Use case 1

    Some description about the use case that makes it interesting and, more importantly, makes the card not too empty.

    See the example

  • Use case 2

    Yet another description about the second use case that, again, makes it interesting and fills the card.

    See the example

docs.title: Use Case 1
docs.text:
The following is just a ridiculous program generated by Claude.

InspirationGenerator.py
import random
from typing import List, Tuple
import time

class InspirationGenerator:
    def __init__(self):
        self.buzzwords = [
            "synergy", "paradigm shift", "digital transformation",
            "blockchain", "AI-powered", "cloud-native", "quantum",
            "disruptive innovation", "machine learning", "IoT"
        ]
        self.profound_starts = [
            "The key to", "The essence of", "The future lies in",
            "Success comes from", "Innovation begins with",
            "Never underestimate", "Always remember that",
            "The secret sauce is", "Wisdom teaches us that"
        ]
        self.profound_middles = [
            "leveraging", "embracing", "transforming",
            "revolutionizing", "reimagining", "disrupting",
            "optimizing", "accelerating", "empowering"
        ]
        self.profound_ends = [
            "in the digital age", "for sustainable growth",
            "in the modern ecosystem", "at web scale",
            "in the metaverse", "with blockchain technology",
            "using neural networks", "in real-time",
            "while maintaining work-life balance"
        ]

    def generate_quote(self) -> str:
        return (f"{random.choice(self.profound_starts)} "
                f"{random.choice(self.profound_middles)} "
                f"{random.choice(self.buzzwords)} "
                f"{random.choice(self.profound_ends)}")

    def add_emoji_decoration(self, quote: str) -> str:
        emojis = ["✨", "🚀", "💡", "🌟", "🎯", "🔮", "💫", "⭐"]
        return f"{random.choice(emojis)} {quote} {random.choice(emojis)}"

def main():
    print("Welcome to the Corporate Inspiration Generator 3000™")
    print("Generating life-changing insights...")
    time.sleep(1)
    generator = InspirationGenerator()

    for i in range(5):
        print("\nGenerating profound wisdom", end="")
        for _ in range(3):
            time.sleep(0.3)
            print(".", end="", flush=True)
        print("\n")
        quote = generator.generate_quote()
        decorated_quote = generator.add_emoji_decoration(quote)
        print(decorated_quote)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()

docs.title: Use Case 2
docs.text:
The following is just a ridiculous program generated by Claude.

CorporateJargonGenerator.cpp
#include <iostream>
#include <vector>
#include <string>
#include <random>
#include <chrono>
#include <thread>

class CorporateJargonGenerator {
private:
    std::vector<std::string> adjectives = {
        "synergistic", "disruptive", "innovative", "blockchain-enabled",
        "AI-driven", "cloud-native", "quantum-inspired", "agile"
    };

    std::vector<std::string> nouns = {
        "paradigm", "solution", "framework", "ecosystem",
        "platform", "pipeline", "architecture", "methodology"
    };

    std::vector<std::string> verbs = {
        "leverage", "optimize", "transform", "revolutionize",
        "streamline", "accelerate", "empower", "orchestrate"
    };

    std::mt19937 rng;

public:
    CorporateJargonGenerator() : rng(std::random_device{}()) {}

    std::string generateBuzzPhrase() {
        auto getRandomElement = [this](const std::vector<std::string>& vec) {
            std::uniform_int_distribution<> dist(0, vec.size() - 1);
            return vec[dist(rng)];
        };

        return getRandomElement(adjectives) + " " +
               getRandomElement(nouns) + " to " +
               getRandomElement(verbs) + " your business";
    }

    void displayWithSpinner() {
        std::cout << "Generating revolutionary business insights";
        for (int i = 0; i < 3; ++i) {
            std::this_thread::sleep_for(std::chrono::milliseconds(500));
            std::cout << "." << std::flush;
        }
        std::cout << "\n\n🚀 " << generateBuzzPhrase() << " 💫\n" << std::endl;
    }
};

int main() {
    std::cout << "Welcome to the Enterprise Jargon Generator 5000™\n" << std::endl;

    CorporateJargonGenerator generator;

    for (int i = 0; i < 5; ++i) {
        generator.displayWithSpinner();
        std::this_thread::sleep_for(std::chrono::seconds(1));
    }

    std::cout << "\nThank you for leveraging our synergistic solution!\n";
    return 0;
}
